Deploying to an invalid location (a root directory defined in a location that 
is invalid) causes the following exception.  I have verified that the same 
problem exists from Windows to Windows and from Windows deploying to Linux.  
To reproduce the problem set a root directory on a location that is invalid 
for the deployment platform, for example, for a Windows deployment location 
set "/some/linux/directory" as the root directory.  This should cause the 
stack trace like below.  The recommendation would be to create a more 
informative error message that instructs the user of the "real" underlying 
problem (malformed directory names) or do early-checking and try to validate 
the root directory before-hand (if possible).
